name: Historic Pioneer Lodge

reviews.text: Had a amazing visit to springdale. I was going to do some price check before I reserve my room, but the manager hooked me up with a really really low rate. I didn't have to go any where else. Free breakfast and free Wifi, included in that low rate. My first property I stayed at where they had 40 Inch TVs. I will ended up staying here again where im in springdale again.
reviews.title: Nice Stay!!

reviews.text: A buddy and I stayed at the Pioneer Lodge in Oct 2012 prior to a multi-day backcountry backpacking trip in Zion National Park. We could not have chosen a better place to stay. The lodge was centrally located in town which made it easy to walk to the nearby restaurants. The park entrance to Zion was only minutes away thus saving us time the next morning by not having to drive too far. Pioneer Lodge’s manager during our stay was Ben Patel. Ben was very friendly & courteous and ensured we were well taken care of. Our hotel room was on the second floor across from the main office. The room appeared to have been recently remodeled with a western them. The view from the front balcony was awesome allowing a nice vantage points for the evening sunset & the morning sunrise against the adjacent foothills. If you are planning a visit to Zion then I highly recommend you consider staying at the Pioneer Lodge for its close proximity to the park, affordable room rates and friendly staff. Thank you Ben Patel for making our brief stay an enjoyable experience. I will definitely stay at Pioneer Lodge for all of my future visits.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights to visit the Zion park: For this purpose the location is ideal, very close to the park. The design of the lodge in 'Western' style fits well to the breath-taking sorroundings and view. The rooms are ok, but could use 'freshening up", in particular the carpet. Free and fast WiFi, a large fridge, microwave, coffeemaker. The safe did not work and was not repaired despite request. Price/Value ok. Breakfast in the restaurant was ok in terms of price and quality, but not more.
reviews.title: Ideal location, nice atmosphere, average rooms

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel during a recent holiday from Britain with my sister and four friends from Salt Lake City. Our reason for staying at Pioneer Lodge, like other reviewers was it's very convenient location for visiting the majestic Zion Nation Park which is close by. The main entrance to the park is just a five minute drive down the road so it is almost on the hotel's doorstep. The hotel is constructed and decorated in a "frontier/wild west" theme which was very appealing to this British visitor and fitted in perfectly with the countryside and stunning views all round. The rooms were comfortable if not large, with fridge, tv, excellent bath and shower facilities and easily regulated heating. We stayed for one night during a cold snap so it was essential to be able to turn the heat up, at some hotels this is a far more difficult task than it should be. I also noted that there were spare blankets in the wardrobe. The hotel has a comfortable reception area where you are able to sit by the warming fire and take it easy. In this area is a bank of computers and a coffee bar selling a wide selection of hot and cold beverages. At the time of my stay the hotel restaurant was closed for refurbishment but Anna the very helpful and friendly receptionist was able to recommend us a local place to eat called Oscar's where we had a delicious evening meal. The hotel restaurant is scheduled to re-open during the month of March. Overall I thought this hotel was excellent value for money, ideally located and as a guest I felt that the staff really cared about how our stay was. I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: IDEAL FOR ZION NATIONAL PARK

reviews.text: The Historic Pioneer Lodge is a perfect place to stay when visiting Zion National Park. The hotel is within walking distance of Zion National Park. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the staff is professional and sincerely friendly. They truly appreciate and take care of their guests. Thank you for a great visit
reviews.title: Great Hotel - beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was clean but a little old minor issue theTV was so old it did not have a HDiMI or a VGA plug so we could not watch movies from my computer, the room was really packed in with 2 beds a table and armoire it was real tight. On the good side a refrigerator microwave and coffee maker was nice the bath was updated and very clean. On the last note the ice maker has a note if you are icing your cooler please pay the front desk a dollar REALLY
reviews.title: Nice inexpensive choice for Zion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the lodge for three nights and enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very polite and helpful. The lodge is located right in the middle of restaurants, shops and galleries and you can catch a shuttle to Zion National Park right out front. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night. Check in was fast & simple with some good advice regarding the area from the young woman behind the desk. We arrived about 2pm & were told to wait an hour to be sure our room was ready. After an hour we entered our room to find some foodsuffs in a takeaway container & a half glass of water with some used brochures lying around. We went back to reception to tell the clerk & we were assured she would look into it.
reviews.title: Filthy Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left the hotel to hike in the N.P., on our return at 6.30pm the room was unchanged & the used items were still there. The items were taken to reception where we were told (a gentleman this time) that the housekeeping staff were short staffed & that this was very out of character for this to happen. We voiced concerns that the beds had not been made as the pillows looked crumpled & the decorative pillows were on the ground. We were assured the beds had been changed as he had seen them being made up. We accepted this & returned to our room, only to find a few hours later, when we decided to shower before going to bed, three used bars of soap (2 in the bath & 1 on the basin with a used face cloth). Closer inspection found another used face cloth draped over the shower head. After showering I also noticed long strands of dark hair on the shower walls....both my husband & I have short hair. It was clear to us that the room had not been serviced fully. It was most unsettling. Next morning on checking out we related what else we had found to the same gentleman we had spoken to earlier. All he could manage was an apology.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: Regarding the room, we had a ground floor room. You could hear every footstep from the room above. This wasn't really a problem until 5am in the morning when the occupants in the room above arose early and began walking around. Being on the ground floor with a window right on the verandah there was little privacy unless you closed the curtains & turned on the lights. The room had complimentry, wireless internet, but it was slow & sometimes not working.
reviews.title: Good Things Come in Small Packages

reviews.text: This nice hotel is just outside Zion NP and it is a perfect place sto stay if you want to visit it. The rooms are nice, all made of wood, and smell good ( it may be a particular parfume that they put on wood), even if they are quite small. The room provides a fridge, a microwave and a coffee machine. Breakfast is not included and the prices at the hotel's restaurant are quite high. By the way, it is full of places to eat really close to the hotel( you can easily walk). We found a good price( it was the less expensive in town), and I can say that the value for money is great. Recommended!!
reviews.title: Perfect place to visit Zion NP

reviews.text: Friendly, courteous staff. The motel was a very convenient distance from Zion National Park, just over a mile. Great food nearby. Our room with jacuzzi was perfect; as was the room. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were surprised how nice the hotel was because of the cost (can't remember how much exactly but think we booked through Priceline and it was under $60). The room was clean and comfortable. The man at reception was friendly, helpful and well-traveled. And, the best part was the location to Zion National Park. The view from the balcony outside the room was of the beautiful cliff faces. We would definitely recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: Room was clean. Layout was good. Bathroom/kitchen combo. Fridge, microwave, paper towels, sink. We expected more of a cottage feel but there was a faux wood wall and the rest was a plaster stucco. The bed was huge logs which was really cool. It was good for the price as well. Our room, a king suite, had some major repair issues which appeared as water damage on the ceiling. Definitely kind of a drawback.
reviews.title: Faux pioneer feel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read all the other reviews about the smells and the poor ratings but I have to say there were no problems with this hotel at all. It was clean and comfortable. The bed and bedding were comfortable , although the pillows could have been renewed. The room was a little smaller than other hotels I have used but it was adequate, the tv was older style but worked. There was excellent wifi Internet connection. A great off season price with booking.com made the hotel excellent value for money. There was no breakfast included but that meant we had a freshly cooked breakfast at a restaurant across the road. The hotel was right at the edge of the Zion park so was great for a one night stay on the way to Las Vegas.....the red rocks form the very picturesque backdrop for the hotel. Cannot complain and would recommend it if you are not too fussy.
reviews.title: Perfect position for Zion Park

reviews.text: The good: Great location in main business district of Springdale, so an easy walk to restaurants and shops, quiet, open all year (we went in February) and very close to beautiful Zion. We got a good deal on Priceline.
reviews.title: Liked the location, not the smell

reviews.text: Not so good: Very smelly bowl of potpourri air freshener stunk up the whole room. Yuck! Good thing I don't have allergies. Oily stains on the bedspreads, although the room appeared clean otherwise.
reviews.title: Great value, but quirky

reviews.text: The price was great. The room was nice and clean. But...
reviews.title: Bit dark but decent wifi and perfect loction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet was very sporadic. I was able to connect only about 1/3 of the time I tried. This normally isn't a problem for me on vacation. But a storm was rolling in and I wanted to keep up on the forecast and road conditions.
reviews.title: It was OK.

reviews.text: The hot tub was closed, even though it said it was open.
reviews.title: Great and safe lodge for a family

description: The Historic Pioneer Lodge and Restaurant is centrally located in downtown Springdale near the entrance of Zion National Park. We have 40 beautifully appointed rooms in rustic western decor. There is a jacuzzi suite, a one bedroom apartment and a 3 bedroom apartment. On location we have a full service restaurant, open 7 days a week serving excellent quality meals, an Internet Cafe/Espresso Bar and gift shoppe. There is a outdoor pool and jacuzzi. We have guest laundry facilities. Our property has been totally renovated in 2006. We pride ourself in excellent customer service with a relaxing home away from home attitude. We have a 4 diamond rating with AAA.
